bill_title: appropriate federal funds for the continuation of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate federal funds for the continuation of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby annually appropriated to the Unified Judicial System one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal fund authority for acceptance of a grant from the Department of Social Services of moneys obtained from Part D of Title IV (U.S.C. 651-669), as amended, in order to continue the operations of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force, created by Chapter 150 of the 1997 South Dakota Session Laws. The Unified Judicial System may expend no more than thirty-one thousand dollars of this appropriation to pay any expenses of the task force. Section 2. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate federal funds for the continuation of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby annually appropriated to the Unified Judicial System one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal fund authority for acceptance of a grant from the Department of Social Services of moneys obtained from Part D of Title IV (U.S.C. 651-669), as amended, in order to continue the operations of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force, created by Chapter 150 of the 1997 South Dakota Session Laws. The Unified Judicial System may expend no more than ten thousand dollars of this appropriation to pay any expenses of the task force. Section 2. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. BILL HISTORY 1/19/99 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 85 1/26/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 0. H.J. 184

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate federal funds for the continuation of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby annually appropriated to the Unified Judicial System one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal fund authority for acceptance of a grant from the Department of Social Services of moneys obtained from Part D of Title IV (U.S.C. 651-669), as amended, in order to continue the operations of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force, created by Chapter 150 of the 1997 South Dakota Session Laws. The Unified Judicial System may expend no more than five thousand dollars of this appropriation to pay any expenses of the task force. Section 2. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate federal funds for the continuation of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force and to provide for standard request forms for use in certain visitation and custody hearings. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby annually appropriated to the Unified Judicial System one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal fund authority for acceptance of a grant from the Department of Social Services of moneys obtained from Part D of Title IV (U.S.C. 651-669), as amended, in order to continue the operations of the Visitation Enforcement Program Implementation Task Force, created by Chapter 150 of the 1997 South Dakota Session Laws. The Unified Judicial System may expend no more than five thousand dollars of this appropriation to pay any expenses of the task force. Section 2. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. That § 25-4A-2 be amended to read as follows: 25-4A-2. Any party granted visitation or custody rights to a child by a court decree may request the court to enter an order to show cause why the other party should not be held in contempt of court for violation of the decree relating to visitation or custody of the child. Upon receipt of a written request for an order to show cause, the court may issue such an order and forthwith schedule a hearing date not less than thirty days in the future. No particular formality may be is required of the moving party in making a written request for an order to show cause. However, the clerk of the circuit court shall make available standard request forms with instructions for completion to be used by a moving party. The Department of Social Services shall prepare the standard request form. BILL HISTORY 1/19/99 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 85 1/26/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/26/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 0.
